alert.note: Alert for Haywood; Madison (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 17 at 7:48PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Haywood and Madison Counties through 815 PM CDT... At 748 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Holly Grove, or 7 miles east of Brownsville, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Jackson, Bemis, Holly Grove, Mercer, Medon, Neely, Malesus, Allens, Parkburg, Huntersville, Westover, Roberts, Madison Hall, Uptonville, Jones, Gilmore, Denmark, Leighton and East Union. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for west Tennessee.
